casebody.data:
People ex rel. McCully, Appellant, v. Board of Com’rs of Excise, Respondents. (Supreme Court, General Term, First Department. February 18, 1892.) Appeal from special term, Hew York county. Application for a writ of mandamus on the relation of Robert B. McCully against the commissioners of excise of Hew York city.

Argued before Yan Brunt, P. J., and Lawrence, J.

Ezra A. Tuttle, for appellant. Edward Browne, for respondents. Per Curiam.

Our examination of the record in this case satisfies us that the justice who heard the application at the special term was right in refusing to grant the writ of mandamus for which the relator asked. The order belo w will therefore be affirmed, with costs and disbursements.
